title: Citibank Named Best Consumer Internet Bank and Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in the Czech Republic
summary: Prague - Citibank Europe plc in the Czech Republic was named the "Best Consumer Internet Bank" and the "Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in Global Finance magazine's "2013 World's Best Internet Banks" awards. Citi also won several prestigious awards in different categories in countries all over the world, including the Central and Eastern Europe region (CEE).
tag-1: Citibank Named Best Consumer Internet Bank and Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in the Czech Republic
tag-2: Prague – Citibank Europe plc in the Czech Republic was named the "Best Consumer Internet Bank" and the "Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in Global Finance magazine's "2013 World's Best Internet Banks" awards. Citi also won several prestigious awards in different categories in countries all over the world, including the Central and Eastern Europe region (CEE).
tag-3: In addition, Citi is a regional winner in the "Best Investment Management Services", "Best Online Cash Management," "Best Web Site Design," "Best Integrated Corporate Bank Site," "Best Information Security Initiatives" and "Best in Social Media" award sub-categories.
tag-4: "Citibank in the Czech Republic was named the 'Best Consumer Internet Bank' and the 'Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank' by Global Finance magazine for the second time in a row. This award yet again confirms our strong position in the area of innovation and it motivates us to keep focusing on the quality of services provided to our clients," says Michal Nebeský, Citi Country Officer for the Czech Republic.
tag-5: Winners were chosen among entries evaluated by a world-class panel of judges at Infosys, a global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing. The final selection was made by Global Finance editors. Winning banks were selected based on the following criteria: strength of strategy for attracting and servicing online customers, success in getting clients to use web offerings, growth of online customers, breadth of product offerings, evidence of tangible benefits gained from Internet initiatives, and web site design and functionality.
tag-6: Radek Sedlár, Head of Digital Bank for Central Europe, adds: "We will keep focusing on the quality of services provided to our clients and invest in continual enhancement of online channels, so that our clients can comfortably bank from their homes, work or during their travels."
tag-7: The Regional and Global winners for the "Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks and Best Consumer Internet Banks" categories will be announced at an Awards Ceremony in New York City in November and published in the December issue of Global Finance. For more information on the magazine and the competition, visit www.gfmag.com.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
